title: How to Create and Use a SlickPic Account

steps.headline: Go to the SlickPic website.
steps.description: Look around at what it offers.

steps.headline: Click on Create Free Account.
steps.description: You can choose between a Lite Free Account, a Basic Account, and Pro Advanced Account. The differences would be the price and services that come with the price. You can also sign up using Facebook or Google.

steps.headline: Click on Get Started.
steps.description: This will cause an email to be sent to your provided email address. Click on the activation link and then put in the requested information.

steps.headline: Once you are into your userpage (Wall), go to the Edit Profile button in the upper right hand corner.
steps.description: You don't necessarily need to provide a picture, but there is something so unglamorous in an account name of User123456. This is with the original Edit Profile screen. Be aware that the alternative is the name you used to sign up with (usually your actual name). While some don't mind their name being shown, a lot of people do. If you are unsure, stick with User123456.

steps.headline: Click on Personal Info.
steps.description: Here you can give yourself a username that is more anonymous. Be aware that it must be at least 7 characters long.

steps.headline: Continue clicking through the various options to make any changes you want.
steps.description: Be sure to check out the Album and Collection Settings.

steps.headline: Once done, click on My Home at the top center of your screen.
Consider upgrading your account.
steps.description: Yes, it is more expensive than Flickr, but there are perks with the extra cost.

steps.headline: Click on Add Photos to add some pics to your album.
steps.description: If you don't select a name for your album, its name will be, basically, a Date/Time stamp.

steps.headline: Select your images and then upload them.
steps.description: This is the screen that you will see.

steps.headline: Once there, you can reorder them, tag them and many other options.

text: Go to the SlickPic website. Look around at what it offers. Click on Create Free Account. You can choose between a Lite Free Account, a Basic Account, and Pro Advanced Account. The differences would be the price and services that come with the price. You can also sign up using Facebook or Google. Click on Get Started. This will cause an email to be sent to your provided email address. Click on the activation link and then put in the requested information. Once you are into your userpage (Wall), go to the Edit Profile button in the upper right hand corner. You don't necessarily need to provide a picture, but there is something so unglamorous in an account name of User123456. This is with the original Edit Profile screen. Be aware that the alternative is the name you used to sign up with (usually your actual name). While some don't mind their name being shown, a lot of people do. If you are unsure, stick with User123456. Click on Personal Info. Here you can give yourself a username that is more anonymous. Be aware that it must be at least 7 characters long. Continue clicking through the various options to make any changes you want. Be sure to check out the Album and Collection Settings. Once done, click on My Home at the top center of your screen.  Consider upgrading your account. Yes, it is more expensive than Flickr, but there are perks with the extra cost. Click on Add Photos to add some pics to your album. If you don't select a name for your album, its name will be, basically, a Date/Time stamp. Select your images and then upload them. This is the screen that you will see. Once there, you can reorder them, tag them and many other options.
